meanings.definition: Opposition to liberal principles or policies.
meanings.sent1: Many people express their antiliberalisms by advocating for stricter regulations.
meanings.sent2: The antiliberalisms of the group were evident in their protests against free trade agreements.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the absurdity of extreme antiliberalisms.
meanings.sent4: In a world of diverse opinions, his antiliberalisms stood out like a bright red flag.
meanings.sent5: The history books highlighted the impact of past antiliberalisms on societal progress.

meanings.definition: The beliefs or practices of those who are against liberalism.
meanings.sent1: Her strong antiliberalisms led her to join a conservative political party.
meanings.sent2: The conference aimed to discuss the rise of antiliberalisms in modern politics.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character comically embodied extreme antiliberalisms in a fictional world.
meanings.sent4: His family's deep-rooted antiliberalisms clashed with his own progressive views.
meanings.sent5: The documentary shed light on the origins of radical antiliberalisms in society.
